page.title: 06The Smell 3
page.content: full of{lanolin}from the woollen mills. Bradford turned this to good account, extracted the lanolin at Esholt,and sold it to make soap,grease and wax. A group from Nab Wood G.S. was invited to look round the works.They saw 20 deep baths,each one 20 by 30 feet, each filled with deep sewage water. The estate was not just used for the sewage works,however,it also houses Bradford's tree nurseries, where seedlings are grown until they can be transplanted to the cities' streets. A more unusual use for the sewage works some years ago was when the RAC rally ran a special stage through them. As far as we know,none of the cars went into the baths,but some of the drivers were looking distinctly green when they left the stage!!!
